lines.text: [interrupting the trappers' gruesome song about the joys of killing animals]
Oh, stop!
That's sick!
I agree! Nutter was singing in the wrong key!
No I wasn't! It was Loutzenheiser! I was singing in E flat minor.
The SONG'S in F sharp major!
I think they're the same thing. I mean, E flat is the relative major of F sharp.
No it isn't! The relative minor is three half-tones DOWN from the major, not up!
No, it's three down. Like A is the relative minor of C major.
But isn't A sharp in C major?
Wait, are you singing mixolydian scales or something?
A sharp is tonic to C major! It's the sixth!
No it isn't!
Well, it would be like a raised 13th if anything.
[reaching the Grand Canyon]
Come on, we can just walk around it. It can't be that big.
Hey! You're cutting into his butt!
Well what sort of meat do you want?
Well not butt!
[mocking Alferd Packer not explaining the Colorado River beforehand]
'Are there any more big rivers between here and Breckenridge?' 'Oh no, just the Colorado!' THE BIGGEST FUCKING RIVER I'VE SEEN IN MY ENTIRE LIFE, THANK YOU VERY MUCH!
The sky is blue and all the leaves are green. My heart's as warm as a baked potato. I think I know precisely what I mean, when I say it's a *Shpadoinkle* day!
And then I ran and ran as fast as I could.
But you made it out, right?
Yeah, I hid in Wyoming for a while. I should have let them kill me.
Why?
You ever been to Wyoming.
[we cut and see Alferd in a deserted field]
Uh, hello?
Oh my God! It sounds horrible!
Fudge, Packer?
[singing]

Sometimes, the world is black./And tears run from your eyes./Maybe we'll all get really sick./And maybe we'll all die... /Sooooooooooooo, let's build a snowman/We can make him our best friend./We can name him Tom or we can name him George!/We can make him tall, or we can make him not so tall./Snowman!/He'll have a happy face, a happy smile, a happy point of view./If you build me a snowman, then I'll build one for you./So, let's build a snowman!/We can make him our best friend./We can name him Bob or we can name him Beowulf!/We can make him tall, or we can make him not so tall./Snowman!/Hey!
[Tapdance solo]
He'll have a happy face, a happy smile, a happy point of view./If you build me a snowman, then I'll build one for you./Snowman! Snowman! Snowman!
[after finding his companions slain]
Okay, what are you guys doing?

[seeing their dinner]
You son of a bitch Humphrey.
Come on, you haven't even tried it.
[Miller takes a mouthful]
You son of a bitch Humphrey.
[singing about Liane]
Your eyes, your smile,/made my little life worthwhile./The sky was a lot more blue/when I was on top of you.
I know there's more to life then women. I just can't figure out what else there is. I don't need it every night, every morning'd be just fine. A little sex, that's all I'm asking for.
...But that's not the way it happened...
If you don't find a nice girl in Colorado, just remember, there's plenty of mountain sheep.
How big of mountain sheep?
A horse is a horse.
Of course.
Of course.
What part do we eat?
Well, you're the butcher.
Yeah, but...
So, butch!
Can't think, can't move can't speak in complete sentences.
[about his horse, Liane]
She didn't just take off. We're friends, and friends don't just take off.
[after Swan has been shot]
He's dead!
Well no kidding he's dead. His brains are lying in the snow.
[after spotting a sheep, George Noon starts unzipping his pants]
No, to eat.
I know, I gotta take a piss!
God you guys make me sick. What is this, a fucking feel good convention?
Listen, we have a long journey ahead of us. Its important we all get along. Now, you're hurting people's feelings. Your gunna have to find a more constructive way to express your anger.
Okay. Well, fuck you! How's that for constructive?
That's great, now go to time out Mister.
[Noon is trying to flirt with an Indian girl]
I may look tough and mean-spirited but I'm really a sensitive artist.
That's very interesting.
I paint, and I sculpt with my hands.
That's very interesting too.
You have no idea what I'm saying, do you?
That's very interesting.
Ya ya ya! Yoku kita na! Kimi ga kono eiga no shujinkoo nan daroo?
[Hi hi hi! Welcome! I guess you are the heroes of this movie?]
He says...
Who are you assholes?
Oh, he speaks English.
We are from Utah.
Utah?
[Bell holds out the Mormon Bible]
Ah, Utah.
Can you tell us what tribe this is?
We are Indians.
Yes... I can see that, but can you tell us...
You don't believe we are Indians?
No, all...
We have teepees!
[Motions with arms at teepees]
Yes, I see, but...
Look at all these teepees we have... Because, we are...
[looks at companion and folds arms]
Indians!
Trials and tribulations, that's what life's all about! Now are we gonna let this one little thing keep us from fulfilling our dreams?
Yes!
Oh, come on now. We've gotta be strong, don't we?
No!
Oh, gosh, I never thought I'd be sleeping next to a naked man on this trip.
Just do what I'm doing. Just pretend like you're laying next to a nice soft woman.
*What*?
I'm just imagining old Mr. Miller here as a nice tall blonde.
Oh, goddamn it! I want another partner!
How are you doing?
How am I doing? Have you ever been sitting around waiting to die?
Yes! I have as a matter of fact!
When?
Well alright, I've never really...
Excuse me. I've been doing some thinking. Ummm... just kind of looking at our situation here, and I've come to the conclusion that we're completely fucked! Has anybody else made this discovery?
Alferd Packer, any last words?
Yes.

[sighs]
Oh well, make it quick.

Probably the most important thing is that when things get really bad and the world looks its darkest, you just have to throw up your hands and say "Well, alright!" cause it's probably gonna get a whole hell of a lot worse.
Jolly good! Now let's get on with the hanging!
Wait, you guys. Let me talk to them. I know how to speak Indian.
We're gonna die.
Weep-wah, weep-wah, surro no happo?
Nani itto n jaa, omee?
[What the heck are you saying?]
He says, "Welcome to the land of blue light."
[Humphrey simultaneously signs "Jesus Christ is dead."]
Omai wa sono uchi, sakana to ishoo ni onemu suru koto ni naru, zo!
[Keep it up and you'll be sleeping with the fishes, see?]
I am a carpenter, and this is my brother, Tom.
Humphrey, you are so full of shit!
Well, damn! It's good to see some Southern boys! It's been a long time!
[sings]
Oh, I wish I were in the land of cotton, old times there are not forgotten, look away! Look away! Look Awaaaay...
[waits for other to finish]
...You stupid yank!
Oookay... We, we could take our wheelbarrow, build it into a little boat, and then we ride it across, and then build it back into a wheelbarrow again!
How deep do you think it is?
[throws rock in and everybody stares at the splash site for a few seconds]
Well, what the hell was that supposed to prove?
Well, s-s... what... I don't know.
[Alferd Packer is at the courthouse, waiting for the verdict]
The defendant will rise.
[Packer rises]
Alferd Packer, a jury of twelve honest citizens have sat in judgment on your case and have found you... guilty.
[the courtroom buzzes with quiet chatter about the verdict]

Alferd Packer, the judgment of this court is that you be removed from hence to the jail of Hinsdale County, and then be taken to a place of execution prepared for this purpose, within the limits of the town of Lake City, and then and there be hung by the neck until you are dead, dead, dead.
[Packer is aghast at this]

[smiling]
And may God have mercy on your soul.
[lowers the gavel once more, closing the proceedings]
[first lines]

The Musical" soon fell into obscurity. The original negative, re-discovered just last year, has been painstakingly restored using state-of-the-art color enhancing and computer reconstruction technology. The film's violent scenes have been edited out for your viewing pleasure.
[last lines]
Due to the continued efforts of Polly Pry, Alfred Packer was eventually released from prison in 1901.
[repeated line]
The Lord works in mysterious ways.
You guys don't even know what it *means* to be a trapper.
Yeah! Tell 'em, French.
I can catch a helpless animal,/skin it with my bare hands./I wake up muddy,/and I go to bed bloody,/'cause I'm a trappin' man./I can brave the nastiest weather.
Weather!
Even if it's 80 below.
Below!
My pa was an elephant,/but that's irrelevant./My ma was an Eskimo./I eat rabbits' heads for breakfast.
Breakfast!
With beaver butt on the side.
The side!
My mind's magnificent and my body no different./I'm full of trapper pride!/Yo-ho!
Yo-ho!
Yo-ho!
Rip their fur,/cut their skin with my knife./Yo-ho!
Yo-ho!
Yo-ho!
One thing's for sure,/there's nothing like a trappin' life!
I'm badder than the baddest sailor!
Sailor!
I make love to women to 10 feet tall.
Good lord!
I've got a chest of wonder/and balls of thunder./I can break right through a wall./I love the sound of metal,
Metal!
Snapping on an animal's head.
Ka-chink!
Sometimes they scamper,/sometimes they whimper,/but they always end up dead.
I've always wanted to be somebody/who didn't get pushed around./Now that I'm a trapper,/I'm the meanest guy around.

[spoken]
Second meanest!
The blood of a fresh-cut rodent/is as sweet as brandy wine./And the brain of an antelope/tastes like cantaloupe./What a yummy life!/Yo-ho!
Yo-ho!
Yo-ho!
Rip their fur,/cut their eyes out with my knife./Yo-ho!
Yo-ho!
Yo-ho!
Nanda? Sugu kotchi koi! Haiyaku! Haiyaku!
[What the heck? Come here immediately! Quickly! Quickly!]
Kuso, bakayarou! Kono eiga ga daikirai zo.
[Shit, you moron! I hate this movie]
Uh, you guys, I think they want us to follow them.
Ike. Kono eiga ga suggoi baka na eiga da na!
[Go. This is a really stupid movie!]
What should we do?
Maybe they just want Humphrey.
Kotchi koi!
[Come here!]
I guess we don't have much choice.
